content: bag top see photos below continue working through both double_crochet s for the next 19 double_crochet 1 double_crochet into each double_crochet to end 96 37 1 double_crochet into each double_crochet around 96 38 10 double_crochet 25 chain miss 25 double_crochet 23 double_crochet 25 chain miss 25 double_crochet 1 double_crochet into each of the next 13 double_crochet 39 10 double_crochet 1 double_crochet into each 25 chain 23 double_crochet 1 double_crochet into each 25 chain 13 double_crochet 96 40 1 double_crochet into each double_crochet around 96 41 repeat round 42 96 42 repeat round 42 ending with a slip_stitch into the next stitch 96 do not cut the yarn attaching the pocket please note that in this picture the pocket does not yet have the sides sewn together to finish with the last loop of the previous stitch still on your hook turn the work so that the right side is facing complete a row of cord stitch around the top ending with a slip_stitch into the last double_crochet finish off for each handle attach the yarn with the right side facing and complete 1 row of cord stitch around each handle if not already done sew a button into place for the pocket page 4 of 5 © gilly bettney 2008 version 1 2 sew in all the ends your bag is now complete n b a row of slip_stitch can be worked as an alternative to the cord stitch alternatives * try working the trim in a different colour * add crocheted flowers fringes or other motifs to the bag * increase the number of row of 5 chain loops/7 chain loops worked to produce a longer bag * use a thicker yarn and a larger hook to create a larger bag * increase the number of chain when working the handles but still only miss 25 double_crochet to make larger handles if you spot any mistakes in this pattern please do not hesitate to contact me herebegb@blueyonder co uk herebegb etsy com thank-you and i hope you enjoy this pattern page 5 of 5
